p: Cichorium glandulosum Boiss et Huet (CG) is a traditional Chinese herbal medicine derived from chicory roots and seeds, which has been used to treat liver and gallbladder disease [ 1]. Currently, CG is widely used in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region in China, as well as in the Caucasus [ 1]. CG is a Chinese Uygur medicinal herb with a bitter taste and has the functions of clearing the liver and gallbladder, improving digestion, and acts as a diuretic. CG has been reported to be used to treat jaundice, stomach ache, to treat obesity, edema, hepatitis, nephritis, enteritis, tracheitis, and other diseases [ 1].
